metadata.title: CVE-2018-19665 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
The Bluetooth subsystem in QEMU mishandles negative values for lengthvariables, leading to memory corruption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19665` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-block-extra - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-guest-agent - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-kvm - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-system - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-system-arm - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-system-common - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-system-data - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-system-gui - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-system-mips - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-system-misc - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-system-ppc - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-system-s390x - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-system-sparc - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-system-x86 - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-system-x86-microvm - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-system-x86-xen - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-user - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-user-static - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
qemu-utils - 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.2-3ubuntu6.1').
